title: Loop and solenoid - B vs loop r - mu0 and solenoid

content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A group of students wish to verify whether the magnetic field <math alttext="B sub C L, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>CL</mi></msub></math> at the center of a current-carrying circular loop of wire is inversely proportional to the radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> of the loop. The students have a magnetic field sensor, which can be used to measure a component of the magnetic field in any direction, as well as a supply of insulated wire, a variable current source, a voltmeter, and an ammeter.

(a) Describe an experimental procedure to collect data that would allow the students to make a linear graph that could be used to determine whether <math alttext="B sub C L, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mi>CL</mi></msub></math> is inversely proportional to <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>. In your description, include the measurements to be made along with the corresponding equipment needed for each measurement. Provide enough detail so that the experiment could be replicated, including any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.
